issue.title: When running RVIZ tutorial, there is an issue with the lidar

content.raw:
Hi. I have successfully generated a URDF for my\_wamv and I am able to spawn that model in the Sandisland example. Still when I am trying to launch the localization example i get the same error: 

```
$ roslaunch wamv_gazebo localization_example.launch
... logging to /home/markus/.ros/log/316103d2-87c9-11ea-9b91-f40f241b5ede/roslaunch-markus-MacBookPro-18668.log
Checking log directory for disk usage. This may take a while.
Press Ctrl-C to interrupt
Done checking log file disk usage. Usage is <1GB.

started roslaunch server http://markus-MacBookPro:40743/

SUMMARY
========

PARAMETERS
 * /rosdistro: melodic
 * /rosversion: 1.14.5
 * /wamv/rob_st_pub/tf_prefix: wamv
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/base_link_frame: wamv/base_link
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/frequency: 200
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/imu0: /wamv/sensors/imu...
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/imu0_config: [False, False, Fa...
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/imu0_differential: False
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/imu0_remove_gravitational_acceleration: True
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/map_frame: map
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/odom0: /wamv/robot_local...
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/odom0_config: [True, True, True...
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/odom0_differential: False
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/odom_frame: wamv/odom
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/publish_tf: True
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/sensor_timeout: 2.0
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/smooth_lagged_data: True
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/two_d_mode: False
 * /wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization/world_frame: wamv/odom
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/broadcast_utm_transform: True
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/datum: [21.30996, -157.8...
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/frequency: 200
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/magnetic_declination_radians: 0
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/publish_filtered_gps: True
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/tf_prefix: wamv
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/use_odometry_yaw: True
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/wait_for_datum: True
 * /wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node/yaw_offset: 0

NODES
  /wamv/
    rob_st_pub (robot_state_publisher/robot_state_publisher)
  /wamv/robot_localization/
    ekf_localization (robot_localization/ekf_localization_node)
    navsat_transform_node (robot_localization/navsat_transform_node)

ROS_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11311

process[wamv/rob_st_pub-1]: started with pid [18692]
process[wamv/robot_localization/ekf_localization-2]: started with pid [18693]
process[wamv/robot_localization/navsat_transform_node-3]: started with pid [18698]
[ INFO] [1587917689.019331596]: Waiting for valid clock time...
[ WARN] [1587917689.167966823, 19.936000000]: Failed to meet update rate! Took 19.935999999999999943
[ WARN] [1587917689.172521218, 19.939000000]: Failed to meet update rate! Took 19.934000000000001052
[ INFO] [1587917689.277127684, 20.021000000]: Valid clock time received. Starting node.
[ INFO] [1587917689.294993638, 20.032000000]: Datum (latitude, longitude, altitude) is (21.309960, -157.890100, 0.000000)
[ INFO] [1587917689.295061984, 20.032000000]: Datum UTM coordinate is (615116.100362, 2356857.621317)
[ INFO] [1587917689.295127756, 20.032000000]: Initial odometry pose is Origin: (0 0 0)
Rotation (RPY): (0, -0, 0)

[ INFO] [1587917689.313550780, 20.043000000]: Corrected for magnetic declination of 0.000000, user-specified offset of 0.000000 and meridian convergence of 0.007041. Transform heading factor is now 0.007041
[ INFO] [1587917689.313622408, 20.043000000]: Transform world frame pose is: Origin: (0 0 0)
Rotation (RPY): (0, -0, 0)

[ INFO] [1587917689.313667646, 20.043000000]: World frame->utm transform is Origin: (-631694.38578621379565 -2352468.4624987612478 0)
Rotation (RPY): (0, 0, -0.0070405899472914101195)

[ WARN] [1587917689.347575089, 20.067000000]: Could not obtain transform from wamv/imu_wamv_link to wamv/base_link. Error was "wamv/imu_wamv_link" passed to lookupTransform argument source_frame does not exist. 

[ WARN] [1587917691.730013897, 22.067000000]: Could not obtain transform from wamv/imu_wamv_link to wamv/base_link. Error was "wamv/imu_wamv_link" passed to lookupTransform argument source_frame does not exist. 

[ WARN] [1587917693.959395243, 23.986000000]: Failed to meet update rate! Took 0.017000000000000001221
[ WARN] [1587917693.959481555, 23.986000000]: Failed to meet update rate! Took 0.01200000000000000025
[ WARN] [1587917694.070674178, 24.067000000]: Could not obtain transform from wamv/imu_wamv_link to wamv/base_link. Error was "wamv/imu_wamv_link" passed to lookupTransform argument source_frame does not exist. 
```

I have went through the wamv\_gps.xarco and wamv\_imu.xarco files as mentioned in [pull request 216](#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/216/fix-issue-188/diff) and all values seemed to match in both the custom and the example wamv files. Much of this is new to me and I am not really sure what to do.
